modal-dialog.modal-heading: Which filing status should I use?

modal-content.p: If there's no change in your martial status or family situation this year, then you may want to use the same filing status from your tax return.
If you had a change in your martial status or household in the past year, you may need to use a different filing status for a more accurate estimate.
Each filing status has different requirements.

p.strong: Married Filing Jointly and Married Filing Separately:

ul.li: You must meet specific citizenship or residency requirements
You can't be married (or you're considered unmarried for tax purposes)
You must have paid more than half the cost of keeping up a home for a family member or member of your household for a specific amount of time, and they must meet certain requirements
Your spouse must have died in or
You have a dependent child who lives with you all year
You pay more than half the cost of keeping up your home
